intro: Wurfbainia mindanaensis, commonly known as the Mindanao urdung, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palm-like appearance with a single trunk and large, palmate leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland areas with ample sunlight. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
